jparsec.math

Class DoubleVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.DoubleVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class DoubleVector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A vector specialized on doubles.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Yong Wang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DoubleVector()
      Constructs a null vector.
      DoubleVector(double[] v)
      Constructs a vector directly from a double array
      DoubleVector(double x, double y, double z)
      Constructs a 3d vector directly from its components
      DoubleVector(int n)
      Constructs an n-vector of zeros.
      DoubleVector(int n, double s)
      Constructs a constant n-vector.

      • crossProduct

        public DoubleVector crossProduct(DoubleVector v)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns a new vector which is the cross product of current vector with another one. They must be 3d vectors.
        Parameters:
        v - The second vector.
        Returns:
        The cross product.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the size of the vectors is not 3.

      • getAGivenComponent

        public static double[] getAGivenComponent(DoubleVector[] v,
                          int c)
        Returns an array with a given component of a set of double vectors.
        Parameters:
        v - The set of vectors.
        c - A given component, starting with 0 (first).
        Returns:
        The array of double values with that component in each of the vectors.

      • getUnitary

        public DoubleVector getUnitary()
        Returns the unitary vector (same direction, norm2 = 1.0).
        Returns:
        The unitary vector. In case norm2 == 0 null is returned.
